title: The Block's Mark breaks down into tears after he and Mitch ran out of money
text:
They ran out of money on The Block on Monday, putting their build in jeopardy.

And on the show on Tuesday, Stylish grandpas Mitch and Mark hit a low point as they struggled to complete renovations.

At one point, Mark broke down in tears as he felt that it was his fault they were in the red with their budget.

'It feels like I've let people down': The Block's Mark (pictured) broke down in tears on the show on Tuesday and admitted he felt 'hopeless'... after he and Mitch put their build in jeopardy by running out of money

After their builder came to collect his tools from the site, Mark cried and admitted to camera that he went into a 'flat, kind of hopelessness' mood.

'I found that really hard to get out of,' he said.

He also broke down in tears at the end of the episode, saying that as he was in charge of the budget, he 'dropped the ball.'

Emotional: After their builder came to collect his tools from the site, Mark cried and admitted to camera that he went into a 'flat, kind of hopelessness' mood

'It feels like I've dropped the ball on my job and it's put us in a position where we probably won't be able to finish,' he said.

'It feels like I've let people down, everyone on the team who have worked really hard to get this close.'

He added: 'I'm finding it hard to shake this feeling... I feel pretty bad about it.'

Feeling the pressure: He also broke down in tears at the end of the episode, saying that as he was in charge of the budget, he 'dropped the ball'

After seeing the boys struggling emotionally, foreman Keith stepped in and took them for a drink in a bid to cheer them up.

On the show on Monday, the boys were shocked to after they realised they had to pay bills up to a whopping $16,000.

On Tuesday's show, they tried to salvage money and welcomed their builder's family into their home, in the hope that they would buy some furniture for cash.
